column4: Hello I need help with AVG anti virus I downloaded the program and clicked it to install and it installed but it did not show up in applications -- accessories nor can i find it when i click system--- preferences ---Main Menu --- so how do i create an icon for it?
ok you don't need an antivirus in Ubuntu
all you need is a good password for Ubuntu,  and  a firewall,  say in your router, and you should be fine
yes i do and i WANT it
you only need an antivirus in  Ubuntu, if your scanning for Windows viruses
i do need it
why do you think that?

Why do you think you need anti virus?  Ubuntu is not Windows,   Linux is not Windows, as a result  about the only computers that run Linux that need antivirus is   mail servers that scan for Windows viruses
there are criminnals everywhere in the world i just want more protection
probably after a log out, it will show there
i tried to log out no luck
no luck???
i tried to log out but at login it was still not there the button
with Linux you should be more concerned about running bad commands, than getting viruses!
i am equally concerned with all problems i do not discrimanate any problem all problems are equall to me ;)
the only way to  make sure a malicious program is truely  removed, is to re install the OS
even better is simply to destroy the computer ;)
that's a point,  code that is opensource/freesoftware    is usellay more secure, because they can't  hide bad code in it, and  loads of developers  doing stuff with the code
yes that is nice but i want more protection
maybe look into OpenBSD or something like that  then, that's meant to be one of the most secure OS's
,but that's not for newbies
i am a computer newbie
that's for expeirenced computer users
yes exactly, which is why you think it's so important to have antivirus in  Ubuntu, where as  experiended users such as myself, know it's not needed
I have a link that  you may find quite useful
i just want to know how to create the button
by the way antivirus, and antispyware and such  isn't even needed on Windows, if people know what they are doing :)
anyway  Linux is not Windows  http://linux.oneandoneis2.org/LNW.htm
now that's a good read :)
if your so concerned about security, you may want to check out the Backtrack Live CD, it has many security tools.   I haven't used it yet
i just want a button for avg
open it from terinal.  whatever it's called and hit enter     make a shortcut on the desktop for it maybe if you know where it installed
as far as I know   AVG for Linux only scans for Windows viruses, and Windows viruses won't work on a Linux distro
well they might a litlte bit in Wine if you install that, but otherwise no
how do i open it by dubble clicking?
you really are in the Windows mindset,  that can casue problems  when it comes to Ubuntu
and getting help and such
you  can go on  websites that give  Windows useres malware, and laugh when doing it on Linux
to get malware installed on  Ubuntu you would have to find some  rare  malware and install it yourself,  or  get your computer broken into it, and then maybe they do it
i dissagree bad things always happen to me all the time
well that happended a lot with Windows, when it came to a guy I helped with computer,    I got him using Ubuntu, and he is getting on absoutly fine with Ubuntu 8.10
in fact Norton used to just piss him off big time in Vista
i just want to create a button no more no less
and that
yes I know uhmmm
you can make launchers for the program, but you need to know where it is installed
look at this pastebin of the installation http://pastebin.com/m19d2d070
right click on desktop and menu  and create a luancher
i do not understand
it's called a luancher  here not a button or a shortcut
if i right click on the desktop i do not see the word menu
right click on the desktop and  make a luancher.  or you can try right clicking on program menu
if you right click the menu should appear
i am with you
it does not show avg
ok
yes i see
i have right clicked on the desktop and selected create launcher which made a small window pop up
yes and where it says command
that would be the luancher command,  or you can browse for the program
i do not know what the program name is
yes thought would get this issue
if you open synaptic now you can search for AVG and find out the name
huh?
system > administaration > synaptic package manager
then search for AVG
ok
you got a green icon next to  that?  once you searched for it
open up  /opt/avg
good job you did that pastebin by the way, because I woudn't have known where it installed
yes sometimes i get lucky
some where in there should be the program
that you want to luanch
yes of course but i do not know what the program name is or what the linux version of "exe" file is
list the files
what type of files do you have?
i have many different files in many different folders
yes, but in the main AVG folder  should be the program you want to open I think
or in the bin folder
this are the folders that avg has http://img268.imageshack.us/img268/7226/screenshot2p.png
open bin
view > list
ok
and if you press type they will be in alphabetial order by type
which type of files you got?
This feels like a waste of time to me, because I expect when your more experienced, you will reolize that you don't need AVG
this is the screenshot after type
try opening avgscan
yes double click
it will  probably ask you if you want to run it in terminal or something
nothing happens when i dubble click it
maybe it wasn't quite as simple as I thought
plus the whole adding shortcuts  thing in Ubuntu is a bit humm    this is actsually something Windows does better
i will just reinstall linux thanks for your time
hang on?
re install it why?
to make certain everything is gone and i can start fresh, with another program ;)
why do you think you have virus?
bye and thank you very much for your effort
